intro: Plagianthus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading plagiathus, is a herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clustered, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Plagianthus diffusus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
